text: In spite of its association with <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro , however , we found a lymphoid cell - specific nuclear factor in vivo that contains <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but not <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> epitopes ; this factor , termed <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B binding factor II , appears to contain the <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> homodimer and preferentially recognizes several <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B-related kappa B motifs .

text: Although it has been previously shown that the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B motif functions as a potent IL-1 / <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive element in nonlymphoid cells , its activity was found to be repressed in lymphoid cells such as a Jurkat T-cell line .

We also present evidence that <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B binding factor II functions as a repressor specific for <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B-related kappa B motifs in lymphoid cells .
